lexUnit.name: pretend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: act so as to make it appear that something is the case when in fact it is not.

sentence.text: She had never expected it would be so hard to pretend lack of interest when her very heart and soul were longing to demonstrate her love .
Accountants sometimes pretend interest in the figures , but this subsides when the dealer tells them what they want to hear : " I earn my living by making people money .
She turned away , pretending indifference .
She was a beautiful woman who had found him attractive , or at least pretended to do so .
They could no longer pretend they were just hunter and hunted .
She could at least pretend some sorrow .
I turn over and pretend I 'm still asleep but she pulls the duvet off me and switches the lights on .
She could pretend no longer .
Blanche pretends to be so well brought up that she can not go in .
She pretended to search in the folds of her habit , where she had previously concealed the fox bag .
Patrice pretended not to have heard .
Zen had pretended not to understand .
We 're not pretending that we 're in love with each other .
He tried to pretend that the whole episode had n't happened .
` I can not pretend that I shall ever like him , " said the lawyer .
They pretend for my sake they do n't worry .
She knew he was only pretending for the benefit of their audience .
She pretended to think for a moment .
He could n't keep pretending that Viola and Eleanor were the same person because Viola 's photo was signed .
Those books Thrse read too but pretended she did n't because then she 'd have to go to confession about them and spell out exactly what she 'd thought .
I do pretend a little , especially since Richard died .
Blanche pretends to be shocked by the surroundings that Stella is living in with her husband , when she arrives .
James studied the title page and for twenty seconds pretended to be fascinated by the contents of page one .
Even so , she had to pretend to like it , particularly because it had been given to her by her father .
There are those in the House who pretend that that is not so .
Then I put my hair up with one hand and pretended I was a model .
She would touch her hair then fiddle with her hat and pretend to straighten her dress .
Or at least Mr Peckham pretends to have none .
They pretended that what was happening was not happening , and if it were to happen , it would certainly never happen to the likes of them .
At least they never pretended to be pure .
Lonie and Thrse pretended not to notice him .
It was ridiculous to pretend that there was anything immoral about the cinema .
The children then pretend that one of them is the reflection in the mirror .
He said he needed me to pretend to be his girlfriend to protect him from the bimbos . "
She pretended to read it , hands sunk into the pockets of her skirt .
